data.question: What is the empirical formula of compound 1?
What method was used for the crystal structure analysis of compound 1?
At what temperature was the hydrothermal reaction for synthesizing compound 1 carried out?
What is the Langmuir surface area of compound 1?
Does compound 1 retain its crystallinity upon dehydration?
Is the magnetic hysteresis loop observed for compound 1 at 2 K?
Can the self-assembly of organo-polymetal clusters and metal ions potentially lead to magnetic porous metal−organic frameworks?
What is the main reason for selecting citric acid in the synthesis of compound 1?
data.answer: Citric acid has been widely used to produce high-nuclearity magnetic clusters and its O atoms at the periphery of the clusters can make them versatile building blocks.

data.question: What is the significance of the decorated anatase framework being porous?
data.answer: It allows for channels along the [1 0 0] and [0 1 0] axes, which are larger than those in anatase, contributing to its microporosity.

data.question: Is the cobalt in compound 1 in a divalent state?
What is the role of KOH in the synthesis of compound 1?
data.answer: KOH acts as a base in the hydrothermal reaction.

data.question: Does compound 1 exhibit antiferromagnetic behavior below 43 K?
What is the crystal system of compound 1?
What is the pore volume of compound 1?
Is the magnetic behavior of dehydrated compound 1 similar to that of the hydrated form?
data.answer: Yes, both forms exhibit spin-canted antiferromagnetic state and magnetic hysteresis loop at 2 K.

data.question: What is the canting angle φ for dehydrated compound 1?
What is the significance of the canting angle in compound 1?
data.answer: The canting angle indicates the degree of deviation from a perfect antiferromagnetic alignment, contributing to its magnetic properties.

data.question: Does compound 1 have the anatase topology?
What is the role of ethanol in the synthesis of compound 1?
data.answer: Ethanol acts as a solvent in the hydrothermal reaction.

data.question: Is the decorated anatase framework of compound 1 achieved through the assembly of an analogue of polyoxometalates?
